page.title: 07PLOCKTON'S ANIMALS.
page.content: MOST OF US HAVE SOME KIND OF{PET.}THE FAVOURITES ARE DOGS AND CATS.THERE ARE ALSO RABBITS,SOME HAMSTERS,FISH,GUINEA PIGS AND A TORTOISE.THERE ARE 12 PET { {PONIES AND HORSES}WHICH STAY IN THE FIELDS AT ACHNANDARACH OR ON THE BRAE BEHIND THE VILLAGE.THERE ARE{62 SHEEP} AT DUIRINISH AND ACHNANDARACH,BUT NONE IN PLOCKTON.ONLY 7 FAMILIES NOW KEEP{ {HENS}AND THESE ARE ALL FREE RANGE. THERE ARE{109 COWS}IN THE AREA,WHICH BECAUSE OF CROFTING RIGHTS ARE ALLOWED TO ROAM ALMOST ANYWHERE.IF GATES ARE LEFT OPEN,THEY GET INTO THE GARDENS AND DAMAGE THE PLANTS.OFTEN THE TRAFFIC HAS TO STOP FOR THEM AS THEY PLOD UP THE ROAD.EVEN CATTLE GRIDS DO NOT STOP THEM.THERE IS A FLOCK OF ABOUT{15 GEESE}WHICH BELONG TO NO-ONE AND ROAM FREELY.THEY EAT A LOT OF GRASS,AND EACH YEAR THEY NEST ON THE ISLAND AT THE END OF HARBOUR STREET.
